title: Biden won't send US troops to Ukraine, but that isn't stopping these veterans from helping
description: The Biden administration committed to $1.7 billion dollars in aide for Ukraine but it doesn't include sending US troops. CNN meets US military veterans who are stepping in to help train Ukrainian soldiers to fight against the Russian military.

title: Will Boris Johnson resign after partygate?
description: Bianca Nobilo breaks down Prime Minister Boris Johnson's future, after he became the first sitting UK PM to be punished for breaking the law. Johnson, who offered a full apology, received a fine for breaking lockdown rules and attending a party at Downing Street. The Global Brief is available on CNNI and CNN+ — CNN's new subscription streaming service.

title: It's been a bad day for Boris Johnson, but he could still ride out the Partygate scandal
description: It's been said many times in the last three years, but this could be the worst day of Boris Johnson's political life.

title: 'Recession shock' is coming, Bank of America warns
description: Bank of America is warning that high inflation poses a credible threat to the economic recovery that began just two years ago.

title: An unintentionally revealing line in a Donald Trump un-endorsement
description: Donald Trump hasn't decided who he will endorse in the Pennsylvania governor's race this fall.

title: Rihanna says there is 'no way' she'll buy maternity clothes
description: Rihanna has been unapologetic in her bold, fashion-forward maternity looks since announcing her pregnancy with partner A$AP Rocky in January, delighting fans with her choice of crop tops, sheer dresses and belly chains. Now, she's the star of American Vogue's May issue, fronting the title in a fiery red lace bodysuit and matching gloves from AlaIïa.

title: Oil races back above $100 a barrel
description: Turbulence in the oil market continued on Tuesday, with crude prices soaring back above $100 a barrel on concerns about a loss of supply of oil from Russia and signs that lockdowns in China may be easing.

title: Massive comet will swing by the sun in 2031, Hubble observes
description: A comet with a nucleus larger than the state of Rhode Island is heading our way, but Earth is in no danger of a "Don't Look Up" situation, astronomers say.

title: Nokia and Ericsson halt new business in Russia. Is Huawei next?
description: Nokia has announced its exit from Russia, while rival Ericsson is putting its business there on hold indefinitely, throwing into doubt the country's ability to build super-fast 5G networks.

title: 'Stranger Things' debuts new trailer for its creepy upcoming season
description: "Stranger Things" is approaching its final run, but it still has some creepy scares left in store.

title: Kim Kardashian 'wasn't planning on' a relationship with Pete Davidson
description: Kim Kardashian did not see love coming with Pete Davidson.

title: Italy seizes properties worth $114 million from former F1 driver and billionaire father
description: Italy has seized properties valued at €105 million ($114.32 million) belonging to Nikita Mazepin and his oligarch father Dmitry, Italian financial police confirmed in a statement Monday.

title: How Russians born in the 1990s became Putin's soldiers
description: In the summer of 1991, I was a 19-year-old journalist hitchhiking across America with a friend, on assignment for a Moscow newspaper.

title: The climate crisis is supercharging rainfall in hurricanes, scientists report
description: The rainfall from hurricanes during the deadly, record-breaking 2020 season was as much as 11% higher because of the human-caused climate crisis, scientists reported Tuesday.

title: Boeing loses more than 90 jet orders due to war in Ukraine
description: Boeing is likely to lose about 90 jet orders due to "geopolitical issues" related to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the company said Tuesday.

title: The plane wing design that changed flying
description: What caught your eye the last time you looked out of your airplane window? It might have been the winglet, a now ubiquitous appendage at the end of each wing, often used by airlines to display their logo and put their branding in your travel pictures.

title: Extreme populists rise again in the US and Europe as Putin assaults the world order
description: A fresh tide of extreme populism -- feeding on economic strain, hostility to immigrants and cultural warfare -- is challenging key democracies from the inside at the same time Russia escalates the most brutal assault on the liberal Western order in decades.

title: The travel photo project that aims to change the meaning of 'all-inclusive'
description: Some of the world's most innovative artists and photographers have teamed up with a cruise line in a bid to help change the face of travel marketing.

title: Trevor Reed's appeal in Russia sent to a lower court, US ambassador says, and 'justice has again been denied'
description: A Russian court on Tuesday remanded the case of Trevor Reed, a former US Marine detained in Russia, to a lower court for review, said US Ambassador John Sullivan, who was at the proceedings.

title: Should scientists cut ties with Russian colleagues over Ukraine?
description: There are crucial moments in life when there are no good options and people must choose between the lesser of two evils. The world's scientific community is faced with such a situation. Russian scientists are important contributors to some of the most exciting international research being conducted. Yet the Russian military has invaded the neighboring country of Ukraine.

title: Covid lockdowns are causing chaos in the world's biggest car market
description: Factories shut down, new model launches delayed and sales plunging. China's huge car market has been thrown into disarray by the country's latest Covid surge, with stringent lockdowns across several cities hitting vehicle production.

title: Oklahoma governor to sign near-total ban on abortion into law Tuesday
description: Oklahoma Republican Gov. Kevin Stitt on Tuesday will sign a bill into law that makes performing an abortion illegal in the state, with an exception only in the case of a medical emergency.

title: Are cities 'spongy' enough to handle floods? New climate resilience report points to nature for solutions
description: Soft and full of holes, sponges absorb and retain water. With heavy rainfall and storms predicted to increase due to climate change, cities that are equipped with plenty of permeable surfaces such as parks, trees and lakes that soak up water like sponges, will be better able to mitigate floods.

title: Why Russian TV propaganda is crucial to understanding the war in Ukraine
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Honda joins electric car race with $40 billion investment
description: Honda is joining the flurry of global automakers spending tens of billions of dollars to go electric.

title: UEFA orders partial closure of Atlético Madrid's stadium
description: UEFA -- European football's governing body -- has ordered the partial closure of Atlético Madrid's Wanda Metropolitano Stadium for its Champions League quarterfinal second leg against Manchester City on Wednesday as a sanction for the behavior of its supporters.

title: Pressure builds as Shanghai, a city of 25 million, remains locked inside
Biden will announce emergency waiver on summer ethanol ban to combat rising gas prices
description: President Joe Biden on Tuesday will announce new steps his administration is taking to address rising gasoline prices across the country, including emergency measures to expand biofuel sales, countering rising energy prices amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Shanghai residents grow desperate as lockdown causes supply shortage
description: CNN's David Culver describes the stressful living conditions and supply shortages Shanghai residents face as he stays in the country through his second week of the Covid-19 lockdown.

title: Arkansas hit by 'large, extremely dangerous' tornado
description: A storm system lashing states from Oklahoma into the Midwest brought tornadoes and hail to Arkansas Monday.

title: Teen Olympian dies in training accident
description: Teenager Eya Guezguez, who sailed for Tunisia in the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, died in a training accident Sunday, according to a Facebook post from the Tunisian Olympic Committee.

title: This country has a long, brutal history with Russia. They fear they'll be next
description: CNN's Matt Rivers reports many citizens of the former Soviet state Georgia worry they could be Russian President Vladimir Putin's next target if he succeeds in Ukraine.

title: How one man's surfboard became a touching tribute to the lives of thousands of people
description: A funeral oration or an obituary is traditionally how we honor those who have died. But the way we remember loved ones is changing, as thousands of families turn to one project using TikTok and a surfboard.

title: Indonesia police fire tear gas as students protest cooking oil prices and third term for president
description: Indonesian police fired tear gas and water cannon on Monday to disperse hundreds of university students protesting high cooking oil prices and a mooted extension of President Joko Widodo's stay in office.

title: Indonesia passes landmark sexual violence bill, overcoming conservative opposition
description: Indonesia's parliament passed on Tuesday a long-awaited bill to tackle sexual violence, aimed at providing a legal framework for victims to secure justice in a country where sexual abuse has often been regarded as a private matter.

title: Having allergies or asthma may raise risk of heart disease, study finds
description: If you have a history of asthma or allergies, you may be at increased risk of developing high blood pressure and coronary heart disease, new research finds.

title: Award-winning photos capture Dutch communities frozen in time
description: A fisherman's wedding ring looped around a neckerchief for safekeeping. Buttons made of precious metals to serve as a form of life insurance for the wearer. Sculptural white hats made from fabric stretching up to 10 feet long.

title: WNBA drafts its first player from an HBCU in 20 years
description: No player from a historically Black college or university has been drafted into the WNBA since 2002. On Monday night, that finally changed.

title: At least 25 dead in landslides, floods after tropical storm Megi hits Philippines
description: Philippine authorities said on Monday at least 25 people had died in landslides and floods caused by tropical storm Megi as it hit the eastern and southern coasts of the Southeast Asian country.

title: WNBA commissioner voices support for basketball star detained in Russia
description: Ahead of Monday's WNBA draft, commissioner Cathy Engelbert reaffirmed the league's commitment to helping bring Phoenix Mercury star Brittney Griner -- who has been detained in Russia since mid-February -- back home.

title: 'People often cry during their questioning': CNN speaks to woman investigating Russian war crimes
description: CNN speaks with investigators and Ukrainian witnesses who testified about the brutality they witnessed by the Russian military for prosecutors building a case to charge Russia with war crimes.

title: Twitter hilariously reacts to police pulling over driverless car
description: Perplexed police pull over driverless car but find no one behind the wheel. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports it took off midway through the traffic stop.

title: 2.5 tons of unexploded ammo destroyed around Kyiv in past week
description: On the outskirts of Kyiv, Lt. Col. Mykola Opanasenko kneels down in a remote field as he winds up a small electrical generator to power a blast.
